intro: Cissampelos canescens, commonly known as the woolly ant plant, is a climbing herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by distinctive, spiny fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
